alert.note: Alert for Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 06 at 5:24PM EDT until May 06 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR NORTHAMPTON...SOUTHEASTERN GREENSVILLE...WESTERN SOUTHAMPTON AND CENTRAL SUSSEX COUNTIES... At 524 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Courtland to near Seaboard, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include... Garysburg, Boykins, Sussex, Conway, Seaboard, Newsoms, Stony Creek, Homeville, Claresville, Green Plain, Jackson, Severn, Capron, Lasker, Branchville, Milwaukee, Adams Grove, Grizzard, Booker and Yale. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
